Submodules¶

Mikado.subprograms.compare module¶

This subprogram is my version of ParsEval/CuffCompare. It produces class codes for each prediction transcript, like cuffcompare, and its output statistics are blatantly copied by that program; however, it is more affine to ParsEval in the sense that its only purpose is to compare two sets of annotations, with no interest in assembling or checking the expression.

Mikado.subprograms.compare.compare_parser()[source]¶

The parser for the comparison function

Returns:the argument parser

Recursive method to get a nested key from inside the “default” dict and transfer it, keeping the tree structure, inside the new_dict :param new_dict: dictionary to transfer the key to :param key: composite key :param default: dictionary to extract the key from :return: new_dict (with updated structure)

Mikado.subprograms.pick module¶

Launcher of the Mikado.py pick step.

Quick method to check the consistency of run option settings from the namespace. :param args: a Namespace :return: args

Mikado.subprograms.pick.pick(args)[source]¶

This function launches the pick step, using the data derived from the Namespace. :param args: argparse Namespace with the configuration for the run.

Parser for the picking step.

Mikado.subprograms.prepare module¶

Subprogram that constitutes the first step of the Mikado.py pipeline.

This function defines the parser for the command line interface of the program. :return: an argparse.Namespace object :rtype: argparse.ArgumentParser

Mikado.subprograms.prepare.setup(args)[source]¶

Method to set up the analysis using the JSON configuration and the command line options.

Parameters:args – the ArgumentParser-derived namespace.

Mikado.subprograms.serialise module¶

This subprogram is the second step in the pipeline. Its purpose is to create the database that is needed by pick for fast access to the data necessary during the analysis.

Mikado.subprograms.serialise.load_blast(args, logger)[source]¶

Function to load the BLAST data into the chosen database.

Parameters:
  • args – the Namespace with all the details from the command line.
  • logger ((None | logging.Logger)) – the logging instance.

Module contents¶

This module contains the ORM modules necessary to create the starting DB from the input data.
